body:
Im talking about Perm. Bans for having a lot of infractions. I had seen two cases of this and i think its ridiculous to Perm. Ban someone for this.

So, why Perm. Bans for having a lot of infractions (16 i think) isn't automatic?

Another thing is that players needs to be warned about this before they get the 16th infraction.
~Netux
body_tagged:

title: Punisheable but no Automatic?

replies.body: I thought at Infraction 20 it will be automatic. I think it's good, because you did many mistakes and then it is enough. It prevent the player to harm the Network.
replies.body_tagged: I thought at Infraction 20 it will be automatic. I think it's good, because you did many mistakes and then it is enough. It prevent the player to harm the Network.

replies.body: Anymore than 9 should be enough to be pb'd. if you break the rules more than 3 times, you know the rules but chose to disobey them. Thats an attitude we can't have here
replies.body_tagged: Anymore than 9 should be enough to be pb'd. if you break the rules more than 3 times, you know the rules but chose to disobey them. Thats an attitude we can't have here

replies.body: True Words, but I think when you break the rules 3 times in one or two weeks, you'll be banned. Or if you have 3 TempBans = Permanentban, after another infraction.
replies.body_tagged: True Words, but I think when you break the rules 3 times in one or two weeks, you'll be banned. Or if you have 3 TempBans = Permanentban, after another infraction.

replies.body:
I agree about it being stupid. I mean, 


You Have Been Banned For:
         Too Many Infractions

IDEA:
If the player has been punished for the same thing over 6x, they should be banned.

replies.body: I know, but it would e great if you can remove some infractions after a specific time. And if a player do very much for the Network, then the automatic system will be expanded to 30 infractions for that player.
replies.body_tagged: I know, but it would e great if you can remove some infractions after a specific time. And if a player do very much for the Network, then the automatic system will be expanded to 30 infractions for that player.

replies.body:
Wait. I think the multiple infractions means that you did something way too many times that you should be banned. 

I guess in a way it's just that the server can't "trust" you anymore.
replies.body_tagged:
Wait. I think the multiple infractions means that you did something way too many times that you should be banned.

replies.body: I agree, the infractions should automaticly appeal themselfs after 4 months, unless it was a tempban or a permban or a web(temp)ban. Plus some of mine are misunderstandings and false, so that would be a plus to me and other people that had to go through what I've been through.
